alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 30 at 4:30AM PST until December 02 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 11 inches, except 1 to 2 feet west of highway 395. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult with hazardous conditions impacting the morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall rates are anticipated on Thursday and could reach 3 inches per hour at times. The combination of heavy snow and wind may bring periods of whiteout conditions. For road conditions, check with Caltrans at quickmap.dot.ca.gov.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
